intro: Bomarea trachypetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bomarea, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and striking, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Bomarea trachypetala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous areas.
